data.name: Battery Charge!
data.description:
Your phone is battery low! Find out if it lasts long enough for you to finish your affairs.
  • The battery charges from 0 to 100 % in exactly 2 hours
  • It consumes 1% for 2 minutes of active usage and 1% for 3 hours of standby
    • (all time-parameters are given in minutes)
Your task is to implement two functions: ```afterIdle``` and ```hasJuice```
  1. "afterIdle" should return the battery percent (rounded to the nearest integer) for the current battery (provided in the constructor), considering the ```idle``` time
  2. "hasJuice" should return false if the current battery runs out of juice through the ```needFor``` time, or true if it doesn't (either by using/not using the extra charges). Three parameters are given:
    • ```needFor``` the time we need the phone to still run
    • ```activeUse``` the amount of active usage on the phone
      (also take into consideration the idle time, when returning your solution)
    • ```extraCharges``` (optional parameter) a hash object, for example ```{extra:2, minutes:5}```, where extra is the number of times you may charge your phone on the fly for a specific number of minutes for each charge

Now you're in charge!
